text: Why are Senate Republicans rushing Judge Kavanaugh’s hearings before even the records they asked for are available?

html: The Senate Judiciary Committee only has 2% of Judge Kavanaugh’s White House record. How are Senators supposed to question a lifetime Supreme Court nominee without reviewing his or her full record?
text:
The Senate Judiciary Committee only has 2% of Judge Kavanaugh’s White House record.  

How are Senators supposed to question a lifetime Supreme Court nominee without reviewing his or her full record?

html: Anyone who believes in transparency should be asking why.
text: Anyone who believes in transparency should be asking why.

html: Let’s be clear about what’s happening: Judge Kavanaugh’s confirmation hearings are in just a few weeks. Yet, only 1% of his White House documents are public. 99% of Justice Kagan’s White House record was provided to the public.
text:
Let’s be clear about what’s happening: Judge Kavanaugh’s confirmation hearings are in just a few weeks. Yet, only 1% of his White House documents are public. 

99% of Justice Kagan’s White House record was provided to the public.

html: This is a disservice to the United States Senate and to the American people who are entitled to see these records and to have them inform our confirmation hearing of the President’s nominee for the Supreme Court.
text: This is a disservice to the United States Senate and to the American people who are entitled to see these records and to have them inform our confirmation hearing of the President’s nominee for the Supreme Court.

html: Instead, the Committee will only see documents that Judge Kavanaugh’s former deputy selects and releases to the Senate — and he has only given us two percent of the total records.
text: Instead, the Committee will only see documents that Judge Kavanaugh’s former deputy selects and releases to the Senate — and he has only given us two percent of the total records.

html: Let’s be clear about what’s happening: the National Archives has millions of pages of records on Judge Kavanaugh, and those records belong to the American people. Even Chairman Grassley asked for 900,000 pages from the Nat’l Archives, but Republicans won’t even wait to get those

text:
The answer to all of this is easy. Let’s just do this the way it’s supposed to be done:
1. Get Judge Kavanaugh’s full record from the National Archives.
2. Review the record.
3. Vote for or against his confirmation.
That isn’t too much to ask-it’s the least our county deserves.

html: The point of all this is: Science matters. The facts and research that drive science matter. And we should make sure that as we set policy for the United States, we’re utilizing science, scientists, and all the available facts, analysis, and data sets we can get our hands on.

The point of all this is: Science matters. The facts and research that drive science matter.

html: We need to approach this with the right policies and the right attitudes. We don’t need a War on Drugs approach – we need to let people know how dangerous these drugs are, and for those who are already addicted – we need to get them the help and care they need.
text: We need to approach this with the right policies and the right attitudes. We don’t need a War on Drugs approach – we need to let people know how dangerous these drugs are, and for those who are already addicted – we need to get them the help and care they need.

html: The opioid crisis is a public health crisis. The people who are suffering from addiction are not drug addicts who should be punished – they’re our loved ones, our neighbors, and our friends – and we need to care for them.
text: The opioid crisis is a public health crisis.  The people who are suffering from addiction are not drug addicts who should be punished – they’re our loved ones, our neighbors, and our friends – and we need to care for them.

html: That’s what we call the #skillsgap & that’s where #apprenticeships come in. The data speaks for itself: more than 90% of those who complete #apprenticeships land jobs with starting annual wages that exceed $60,000.
text: That’s what we call the #skillsgap & that’s where #apprenticeships come in. The data speaks for itself: more than 90% of those who complete #apprenticeships land jobs with starting annual wages that exceed $60,000.

html: According to the National Skills Coalition, there are 5.9 million job openings in the U.S. & 6.6 million unemployed Americans. But, here’s the problem: many of these unemployed Americans don’t have the skills they need to fill these open jobs.
text: According to the National Skills Coalition, there are 5.9 million job openings in the U.S. & 6.6 million unemployed Americans. But, here’s the problem: many of these unemployed Americans don’t have the skills they need to fill these open jobs.

html: Apprenticeships are what I like to call "the other four-year degree,” because they often lead to a well-paying job, a clear career path upon graduating, little to no debt, & skills that you can use for a lifetime.
text: Apprenticeships are what I like to call "the other four-year degree,” because they often lead to a well-paying job, a clear career path upon graduating, little to no debt, & skills that you can use for a lifetime.

html: On Capitol Hill, we spend a lot of time talking about how important it is to invest in four-year degree programs, which indeed are critical investments. But there are other pathways that young people can take to build a successful career, such as #apprenticeships.

html: Today’s announcement is further proof that President Trump does not have a clear strategy for dealing with Iran, and that is dangerous not only for the United States, but also for the world.

html: In the Senate, the most common conversation topic is a simple one: jobs. How do we create more of them? How do we ensure that Americans have the skills they need? In these discussions, we can’t forget about a proven way to train Americans for lifelong careers: apprenticeships.

html: It’s critical that we prioritize our efforts to counteract counterfeiting so that trademark- & IP-intensive industries can fuel our economy. It will continue to be a priority of mine in the Senate. #WorldIPDay
text: It’s critical that we prioritize our efforts to counteract counterfeiting so that trademark- & IP-intensive industries can fuel our economy. It will continue to be a priority of mine in the Senate. #WorldIPDay

html: The sports industry faces counterfeiting challenges from all directions, where valuable trademarks are misused. We’ve seen efforts to fix this problem, but there’s still a lot to do. We need to be vigilant & educate customers. #WorldIPDay
text: The sports industry faces counterfeiting challenges from all directions, where valuable trademarks are misused. We’ve seen efforts to fix this problem, but there’s still a lot to do. We need to be vigilant & educate customers. #WorldIPDay

html: Trademarks & other forms of intellectual property play a vital role in our economy & in the global marketplace. Proud to speak w/ experts yesterday on the importance of trademarks in the sports industry #WorldIPDay
text: Trademarks & other forms of intellectual property play a vital role in our economy & in the global marketplace. Proud to speak w/ experts yesterday on the importance of trademarks in the sports industry #WorldIPDay

html: In 2014 alone, @CommerceGov estimates that trademarks brought over $6T in value added to our economy. That same year, trademark-intensive industries accounted for ~24M jobs. #WorldIPDay

Be reminded that there still over 200 million cases each year and we have the opportunity to make a difference.” - Sen @ChrisCoons #readytobeatmalariapic.twitter.com/Ijmo0vmHpS

html: We have more work to do, with more than 200 million people still suffering from malaria. Nearly 90% live on the continent of Africa, and 70% are under the age of 5. #WorldMalariaDay
text: We have more work to do, with more than 200 million people still suffering from malaria. Nearly 90% live on the continent of Africa, and 70% are under the age of 5. #WorldMalariaDay

html: It is critical that we sustain bipartisan support for American leadership in the fight to eradicate malaria. We have a lot to celebrate, but today should be both a celebration & a challenge.
text: It is critical that we sustain bipartisan support for American leadership in the fight to eradicate malaria. We have a lot to celebrate, but today should be both a celebration & a challenge.

html: Every year, #WorldMalariaDay gives us an opportunity to step back & evaluate our progress. Through the @GlobalFund & the President’s Malaria Initiative, each year we stride closer toward our goal of eradicating malaria.
